content: so IIRC I was grandfathered in to the triage WG because historically I've been relatively active at labeling and closing issues in the rust repo and it seemed like that was the best way to get the appropriate permissions, but I would also be willing to actively participate in the team itself, if anyone can direct me as to what that entails :)
I think there's a rotation to see what PRs are stuck, @DPC would know more

@bstrie sure
as for what it entails you can look up:

  • https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/triage-procedure.html

if you want a TL;DR:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/242269-t-release.2Ftriage/topic/Meeting.202020-10-07/near/212583097

as per on which day:
you can pick wednesdays if that works for you else either sat or sunday
if you have any further questions, let me know
sure, is the idea that different people are assigned to each day? I can take wednesdays and start next week
yes we have assigned days so that the triage work is shared evenly in the week
and once you are done with the triage work for that day you can submit a report in the weekly thread
